it is impossible to recover accounts, and it's by design. I got a new phone and wiped the old one after registering my line account to my Email. I try to log in, and it either says to enter a transfer code from my logged in device, or my password is wrong (it isn't, and I can log in on their website). I have spent money on stickers on my account and there's no way to retrieve it. infuriating.

Installed the app, didnt use it except for just a few messages where one friend made sure I caught my train home. Weeks later got 'temporarily banned', even though I have never broken the rules (or even really used the app at all). Waited, still banned. They won't tell you what rule you allegedly broke or when you'll be unbanned, you can just randomly lose your LINE account apparently. Two stars instead of one because for the brief time it worked, it seemed easy to use.

Stop forcing the LINE VOOM "For You" content every time I open the app. Users are opening LINE for messaging, not to be immediately shoved into unwanted video content. The constant redirection to VOOM's "For You" page is extremely annoying and ruins the user experience. If you continue to force this irrelevant content on us, users will eventually leave the platform. Give us the option to remove the VOOM tab completely, or set the Chat tab as the default landing screen. Fix this immediately!

Line does NOT support Bluetooth devices on Android. Symptom is that while connected to a Bluetooth device, you can hear audio on Line calls (after tweaking advanced call settings... disabling openSL, NORMAL mode and disable HD audio) BUT Line uses the phone's microphone and NOT the Bluetooth device's mic. This can be replicated by using the Test Call feature. As others have mentioned other apps work. Are they actually QAing this app on Android? It doesn't seem like it. Disappointed.

LINE is a popular messaging app, particularly in parts of Asia, known for its diverse features like free calls, texts, and a wide library of stickers and emojis. While it offers a user-friendly interface and customization options, some reviews highlight drawbacks like the lack of end-to-end encryption, issues with transferring data to new devices, and the potential for in-app purchases to become costly.

I literally love using this app, but I'm upset that one old feature was removed by the developers. It allowed us to upload photos and videos like we do on Instagram, but in small circles with close friends and family. I really enjoyed that feature, but unfortunately, it was removed. I still love the LINE messaging app and wish that feature could be brought back.

Don't use if you switch devices often. Works great until it's time to switch to a new device. You must have your old device in working condition connected to the internet in order to transfer your account to a new device. You cannot just log in with a username and password. On your old device you have to request a code to use on your new device. So if you lost or damaged your old device you cannot activate Line on a new device. And email activation doesn't work for switching.

This is the worst messaging app I've ever used in my life. Sending carrier pigeons is better than using this. Image related messages do not go through whether you are on wifi or data. I've updated and un-installed and reinstalled and this is all the help desk people are capable of saying. Text messages always go through in different order than sent. It's easier to breathe underwater than waste your time trying to get this moronic code to work on your device. Literally use anything else.

"Backup" and "Restore" are a lie. Do not trust the backup or the restore option. When transferring devices, "restore" only restores the past week's chats and everything else will still get deleted from your old device. We don't even get the option or time to salvage the rest of the chats from the old device before the app goes and kicks you out for "being on another device" and deletes everything you had without your consent. There are better messaging apps to use than line for group chats, etc.

Only reason why I'm putting my review up with 4 * is because I don't seem to have access to some features. Could be a location issue where my country simply doesn't allow it though, and that's fine.
